title: Glencore Investors Return After Share Rout
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Sep 29, 2015, 10:21 BST - UK Markets close in 6 hrs 9 mins Glencore Investors Return After Share Rout By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 29 minutes ago View Photo 

The massive decline in Glencore (Xetra: A1JAGV - news ) 's share price was arrested on Tuesday after a number of brokers warned that worries about its $30bn (£19.8bn) debt pile were overdone. 
The commodities and mining company lost almost a third of its value on Monday after investment bank Investec Securities warned in a report that Glencore's debt burden would render it virtually worthless unless commodity prices recovered. 
The firm, which announced a plan earlier this month to cut its debt by almost a third, has lost almost 80% of its value since its takeover of Xstrata in 2013. 
Like rivals, Glencore's value has been hurt by the collapse in commodity prices linked to the slowdown in emerging market economies. 
Glencore's net debt to equity ratio has been of particular concern to investors. 
However, its share price recovered some ground on Tuesday - trading up to 7% higher in early trading - on suggestions the Investec (LSE: INVP.L - news ) warning was over the top. 
Analysts at Citi told clients: "In the event the equity market continues to express its unwillingness to value the business fairly, the company management should take the company private, whereby restructuring measures can be taken easily and quickly." 
They kept their 'buy' rating on the shares. 
Glencore has declined to comment on the recent plunge in its market value. 
Its plan to counter the concern over its debts has seen the company suspend dividends, plan to sell assets and raise cash. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) has already raised $2.5bn through a share placement that saw directors and staff take up 22% of the new shares (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
